verses.roman:
yadyapi tinera māyā la-iyā vyavahāra
tathāpi tat-sparśa nāhi, sabhe māyā-pāra

synonyms: yadyapi—although; tinera—of these three; māyā—the material energy; la-iyā—taking; vyavahāra—the dealings; tathāpi—still; tat—of that; sparśa—the touch; nāhi—there is not; sabhe—all of them; māyā-pāra—beyond the material energy.
translation: "Although these three features of the Lord deal directly with the material energy, none of them are touched by it. They are all beyond illusion.
